en.title: Confirm that you intend to defend the divorce
en.defenceFeeDetails: You’ll have to pay a fee and complete another form to defend the divorce. You both may have to attend a hearing where a judge will decide if the divorce should be granted.
en.legalAdviceWarn: You should get legal advice if you’re not sure.

intendToPrevent.heading: If you intend to prevent the divorce
intendToPrevent.summary:
You’ll need to submit another form (known as the 'answer') with your reason for defending the divorce. You’ll also have to pay another £{{ feesDefendDivorce }} fee.

You have 21 days to submit your answer from the date that you first signed into your divorce account.

If you don’t submit the answer by the deadline, your {{ divorceWho }} will usually be able to continue with the divorce as if you didn’t defend it.

makeOwnApplication.heading: Making your own application for divorce
makeOwnApplication.summary: You’ll need to complete a new divorce application and pay the £{{ feesIssueApplication }} fee if you want to apply for the divorce yourself. You have 21 days to submit your answer from the date that you first signed into your divorce account.

Os na fyddwch yn cyflwyno’r ateb cyn pen y 21 diwrnod, bydd eich {{ divorceWho }} fel rheol yn gallu bwrw ymlaen â’r ysgariad fel pe na baech yn ei amddiffyn.
